Subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another
 test
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=g1lzDP-tRVCdQOjbRF341JR1NS27RMlPyKdTJDah6AZ3ijpP

James Abley wrote:

> So, if I have
> 
> protected void exit(int statusCode) {
> System.exit(statusCode);
> }
> 
> in my production code and override just that single method in a testing
> subclass, you aren't happy with that solution? Fair enough, so what are your
> alternatives?

I don't have one. I wish I did. I asked the original question to see if 
anyone knew of an alternative.

In my upcoming talk on code coverage at STPCon next month I've listed 
this as one of the untestable cases that prevents one from reaching 100% 
code coverage, but if I could cross it off that list I'd be happy.

--

subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
